title: Michael Taube: Is the Government Listening to CSIS? That’s Not Entirely Clear
description: Conservative MP Michael Chong rises during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on May 2, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Sean Kilpatrick)

title: Gold Mine Fire in Peru Kills 27
description: Relatives of miners wait at the entrance of the La Esperanza mine, where at least 27 people died in the Yanaquihua district of Arequipa, southern Peru, on May 7, 2023. (AFP via Getty Images)

title: Feds Announce King Charles III Will Appear on New Canadian Coins, $20 Banknote
description: The Royal coin is unveiled by Minister of Public Services and Procurement Helena Jaczek (R) and President and CEO of the Royal Canadian Mint Marie Lemay during coronation celebrations in honour of King Charles III, in Ottawa on May 6, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Spencer Colby)

title: UK Minister Defends Metropolitan Police as Force Criticised Over Coronation Arrests
description: Culture, Media, and Sport Secretary Lucy Frazer leaving 10 Downing Street, London, on March 28, 2023. (Yui Mok/PA Media)

title: South Korean President Yoon Responds to Beijing’s Outcry Against the Washington Declaration
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol speaks at a press briefing at the White House garden in Washington on April 26, 2023. (Madalina Vasiliu/The Epoch Times)

title: BC College of Physicians and Surgeons Must Withdraw All Proceedings Against Ethically Courageous Doctors
description: A sign for a COVID-19 vaccination clinic run by Vancouver Coastal Health in Richmond, B.C., on April 10, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Jonathan Hayward)

title: What We Know About the Chinese Diplomat Involved in Threat Against MP Chong’s Family
description: The Chinese Consulate in Toronto is seen on April 25, 2023. (Andrew Chen/The Epoch Times)

title: Japan Leader Expresses Sympathy for Korean Colonial Victims
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, right, shakes hands with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida during a joint press conference after their meeting at the presidential office in Seoul, May 7, 2023. (Jung Yeon-je/Pool Photo via AP)

title: 12 Killed in Multi-Vehicle Crash in Turkey’s Hatay Province
description: Turkish police officers and emergency personnel work next to burned vehicles after a crash on the Iskenderun-Antakya highway, south Turkey, on May 6, 2023. (IHA via AP)

title: Belgium Detains 7 on Suspicion of Planning Terror Attack
description: Police officers in Brussels in a file photo. (John Thys/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Oil, Gas Companies in Australia to Pay More Tax Under Labor’s Petroleum Tax Reform
description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers during Question Time at Parliament House in Canberra, Australia, on Feb. 14, 2023. (Martin Ollman/Getty Images)

title: Victorian Liberal Leader Will Vote to Expel Exiled MP Moira Deeming
description: MP Moira Deeming leaves the Parliament of Victoria in Melbourne in Melbourne, Monday, March 27, 2023. (AAP Image/Diego Fedele)

title: Challenging Situation for Australians Still in Sudan
description: Evacuees from Sudan wait for their flight at Larnaca airport in Cyprus, on April 27, 2023. (Petros Karadjias/AP Photo)

title: Psychologist Banned Over Affair With Married Client
description: A statue of Themis, the Greek God of Justice stands outside the Supreme Court in Brisbane, Australia, on Oct. 20, 2016. (AAP Image/Dave Hunt)

title: Stabbed New South Wales Customer Service Staffer Recovering Well
description: A police tape in Australia on Nov. 9, 2018. (Robert Cianflone/Getty Images)

title: ‘Why?’ Mother and Child Fatally Stabbed Outside Edmonton School, Police Shoot Suspect
description: Feathers are placed on a pole for a woman and her 11-year-old child, who were stabbed and killed outside Crawford Plains School, in Edmonton on May 6, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Jason Franson)

title: Liberals Reject Balanced Budget and Mandatory Voting as Official Policy
description: A stagehand works on the stage in between presenters at the 2023 Liberal National Convention in Ottawa on May 4, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Justin Tang)

title: Alberta Declares State of Emergency Due to Fires, More Than 24,000 out of Homes
description: An active wildfire, located 25 km west of Lodgepole, 20 km northwest of Brazeau Dam and 14 km southeast of Edson, Alta., is shown in this handout image provided by the Government of Alberta. (The Canadian Press/HO-Government of Alberta)

title: Colombia Cancels Flights Returning Migrants From US, Cites Mistreatment
description: Migrants seeking asylum in the U.S. from Colombia walk by the border fence to turn themselves in to the U.S. border patrol after crossing the border from Mexico at Yuma, Ariz., on Feb. 17, 2022. (Go Nakamura/Reuters)

title: China Ranks 2nd Worst in Latest World Press Freedom Index
description: Police attempt to stop journalists from recording footage outside the Shanghai Pudong New District People's Court, where Chinese citizen journalist Zhang Zhan is set for trial in Shanghai on Dec. 28, 2020. title: Iran Hangs Swedish–Iranian Convicted Over Attack That Killed 25 People
description: The Iranian flag is seen flying over a street in Tehran, Iran, on Feb. 3, 2023. (Majid Asgaripour/WANA (West Asia News Agency) via Reuters)

title: Car Bomb Wounds Pro-War Russian Writer and Kills His Driver
description: Russian writer Zakhar Prilepin poses for a picture in his flat in Nizhny Novgorod, Russia, on Dec. 6, 2008. (Mikhail Beznosov/Reuters)
